title: Fix transaction safety for DB and JSONL writes
description:
BUG: Partial writes to global DB even when JSONL fails. Should rollback DB changes or complete both atomically. Need proper transaction handling to prevent inconsistent state.

REPRODUCTION STEPS:
1. User does NOT run 'trc init' first
2. JSONL file (.trace/issues.jsonl) does not exist
3. User runs 'trc create' command
4. Issue gets created in central DB successfully
5. JSONL export fails (because .trace directory doesn't exist)
6. Result: DB has the issue, JSONL doesn't - data inconsistency

ROOT CAUSE: Commands don't check if project is initialized before modifying DB. DB writes succeed, JSONL writes fail, no rollback.

FIX APPROACH:
- Either: Check for .trace/issues.jsonl existence before DB operations
- Or: Wrap DB + JSONL in transaction, rollback DB if JSONL fails
- Or: Create .trace directory automatically before JSONL export
- Best: Validate initialization upfront and fail fast with helpful error

title: Fix trc list to show backlog by default (exclude closed)
description:
Currently trc list with no --status flag shows ALL issues including closed. Should default to showing backlog: open + in_progress + blocked (everything except closed).

Implementation approach:
1. Update list_issues() to support multiple statuses (accept Optional[str | list[str]] and use SQL IN clause)
2. Update list CLI command to accept multiple --status flags (e.g., trc list --status open --status in_progress)
3. Default behavior when no --status provided: show ['open', 'in_progress', 'blocked']
4. Keep --status any to mean 'show all statuses'
5. Write tests for multi-status behavior
6. Verify all existing tests still pass

This aligns with mental model: trc list = backlog, trc ready = actionable work, trc list --status closed = done.

title: UX improvements from real-world AI agent usage
description:
Feedback from using trace with Claude Code in ynab-budget project.

CRITICAL ISSUES:
1. Better initialization errors - 'FileNotFoundError' should suggest 'trc init'. Got cryptic error when trying to create issues before init.
2. Batch operations - Cannot close multiple issues at once. Need: trc close ID1 ID2 ID3
3. Clearer dependency language - 'Added blocks dependency: A → B' is confusing. Reads like 'A blocks B' but means opposite. Suggest: 'A depends on B' or 'A is blocked by B'
4. Transaction safety - Partial writes to global DB even when JSONL fails. Should rollback or complete both.
5. BUG: trc list --project trace shows wrong project - When run from ynab-budget directory, 'trc list --project trace' shows ynab-budget issues instead of trace issues. But 'trc list --project any | grep trace-' works correctly. Seems like --project flag not filtering properly.

NICE TO HAVE:
6. Priority flexibility - Accept both numeric (4) and text (high/critical)
7. Dependency visualization - Show both dependencies and dependents in tree view
8. Better list filtering - Add --all, --active, --priority flags
9. Dependency removal - trc remove-dependency command (may exist but not documented?)

WHAT WORKED WELL:
✅ Mandatory descriptions (brilliant for AI context)
✅ trc ready command (extremely useful)
✅ JSONL format (git-friendly)
✅ Readable IDs (ynab-budget-1y2ul1 > UUIDs)
✅ Cross-project support

CONTEXT: Using trace with Claude Code to manage ynab-budget project. Tool solves real problem (AI memory across sessions). Core concept is excellent, just needs UX polish on error messages and bulk operations.

Overall Grade: B+ - Would recommend despite rough edges.
